author: macfarla
content:
Something for the agenda if it isn't already - regarding what to do if block not found.

There’s hive tests for eth_getBlockReceipts
but fixing these hive tests broke hive tests for eth_simulate that use a future block, since besu has have common error handling for RPCs. 

Is it expected that we would want different behavior here or should eth_simulate also return null if the requested block is not found?
more context here on this draft besu PR https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/9303

(also this indicates there’s a gap in rpc-compat hive tests for error handling for other RPCs eg eth_getBalance, eth_getCode that will have the same issue/question)

author: s1na
content: It looks like geth nethermind reth are all returning an error here, just with different error codes. I can see both points: stick to the usual approach of returning nil, but also see the point of returning an explicit error because of the complexity of eth_simulate and the many things that can go wrong.
